channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "A guidebook for the optional skill/ability rule" - I'd be glad if you could check it out. It's for the rule where you can use different abilities for skills.

item.title: Re: A guidebook for the optional skill/ability rule
item.content:encoded: Hi I might be wrong but it sounds like you wrote this guidebook. We can look at the guidebook but as a policy we don't put homebrew content on the site unless it's from a major publisher or a key designer that has published WotC content (i.e. Matt Mercer or Keith Baker). If you want people to see it, I'd recommend you post it to a forum like the Unearthed Arcana subreddit or DND Beyond forums!

item.title: A guidebook for the optional skill/ability rule
item.content:encoded:
This guidebook tries to make it easier for players and DMs to come up with ways to use different abilities for skill checks. Usually during a hectic session it's pretty difficult to come up with anything else than str intimidate.

But I can't find a way to send it to you. I can't post links so Google Drive is out. It's a pdf so I attach it to the post either.

Could you help me?

SerLoxy
